Getting Over It with Bennett Foddy is a game that has gained worldwide attention and popularity since its release in 2017. It is a game in which the player controls a man in a cauldron, who uses a sledgehammer to climb different obstacles in the form of mountains, trees, and more. In this article, we will explore what makes this game so special and addictive.

## The Story Behind Bennett Foddy's Creation
Bennett Foddy, the creator of Getting Over It, is a game designer and a professor of bioethics at New York University. He wanted to create a game that would be challenging and frustrating, yet at the same time, addictive. According to Foddy, the idea for Getting Over It came from a dream he had in which he was climbing a mountain with a sledgehammer.

## The Difficulty of the Game
Getting Over It is infamous for its difficulty. The game requires a lot of patience, precision, and practice. Players can easily fall down the obstacles, losing their progress, which can sometimes be quite frustrating. However, this is also what makes the game so addictive. Players want to keep trying until they reach the top and feel the sense of accomplishment that comes with it.

## The Psychology of the Game
Getting Over It uses a psychological technique called "Near-Miss Effect." This means that the game is designed in a way that makes the player think they are close to achieving their goal, but then it becomes harder again, making it frustrating yet addictive. This technique makes the player want to keep playing and trying again to reach their goal.

## The Soundtrack and Commentary
Getting Over It has a unique soundtrack that includes classical music and guitar tunes. The game also has commentary from Bennett Foddy himself. The commentary adds a personal touch and helps the player feel like they are on a journey with Foddy.

## Conclusion
In conclusion, Getting Over It with Bennett Foddy is a unique and challenging game that has gained popularity worldwide. Its gameplay, difficulty level, psychological techniques, soundtrack, and commentary make it addictive for players who want to keep trying until they reach their goal. Bennett Foddy's creativity has helped him create a masterpiece that will be remembered for years to come.
